text: Critical Essays (Contributions to the Study of Popular Culture)

J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series offers a highly entertaining set of variations on three stock formulae for children's fiction: the initiation of a wizard, the boys' school story, and the story of an orphan recovering from loss to find a place in the world.
